messages: 71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (06:55): There are several names that describe particular formats, such as HTML 4.01 Transitional, etc.
71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (06:56): Is there an unofficial, adhoc name given for "html" that are not correct html in any respect other than that it can be displayed in tag-soup mode.
71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (06:57): Such as the random text that happens to use <b>bold text</b> tags, <br/>, etc, but doesn't properly use <html><body> (etc)
71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (06:58): Would calling the format "TAG-SOUP-HTML" be a suitable name, naming it after the class of parsers?
71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (07:01): CPU_FAN: I'm dealing with parsing "html" email messages.
aa0921e42f2f2b81e21c799705479d17 (07:02): I just think your comment was weird
71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (07:02): CPU_FAN: All questions relating to email is wierd. :(
aa0921e42f2f2b81e21c799705479d17 (07:03): I don't think you have keep prefixing your messages with my name
aa0921e42f2f2b81e21c799705479d17 (07:03): no one else is here
aa0921e42f2f2b81e21c799705479d17 (07:03): I'm going to address messages to someone else just for the hell of it

71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (07:04): CPU_FAN: Does a format of "TAG-SOUP-HTML" clearly tell you that the html is _not_ correct - infact, just can barely be rendered by even the most basic HTML message?

71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (07:06): CPU_FAN: What irc client do you use?

71ef0f23986a7ede5516fc9b8021cd45 (07:32): That's fine, so am I :)  I use irssi.
